metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3646 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent: X Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.16 and earlier. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.18-0ubuntu1').
